sentences: Läks sitale, on sital, tuli sitalt.
Olukord on sitt. Ajad on sitad.
context: The Estonian word 'sitt' is a vulgar term for excrement or feces, similar to the English word 'shit'. It can also be used more broadly to mean something completely worthless, bad, or nonsensical. The word has various grammatical forms including sita (genitive), sitta (partitive), and can appear in different cases depending on its function in a sentence.
